Package io.github.ai4ci.util

Class ThreadSafeArray<X>

java.lang.Object
io.github.ai4ci.util.ThreadSafeArray<X>
Type Parameters:
X - the type of elements stored in this array
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class ThreadSafeArray<X> extends Object implements Serializable
A thread-safe, dynamically growing array designed for a write-once-read-many (WORM) pattern.

Writes can be performed concurrently from multiple threads using put(Object). Once all writes are complete, call finish() to seal the array and obtain an immutable, fixed-size snapshot for reading.

This structure assumes two distinct phases:

  1. Writing phase: Multiple threads may call put(Object) or update(int,Object) concurrently.
  2. Reading phase: After calling finish(), only read operations are allowed via get(int), or streaming methods like stream() and parallelStream().

The array is dynamically resized if needed during writes. Resizing is rare and synchronized internally, but has minimal impact on throughput when the final size is preallocated.

finish() blocks until all pending writes have completed before returning the final array.

Author:
Rob Challen

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    ThreadSafeArray.ReadOnlyException
    Thrown when attempting to write to a ThreadSafeArray after it has been finalized with a call to finish().
    static class 
    ThreadSafeArray.WriteOnlyException
    Thrown when attempting to write to a ThreadSafeArray while it is being resized or finalized.

  • Constructor Details

    • ThreadSafeArray

      public ThreadSafeArray(Class<X> type, int size)
      Constructs a new thread-safe array with the given element type and initial capacity.

      If the final size is known ahead of time, it is recommended to preallocate the array to minimize resizing overhead during concurrent writes.

      Parameters:
      type - the runtime class of the array elements
      size - the initial capacity of the array

  • Method Details

    • empty

      public static <Y> ThreadSafeArray<Y> empty(Class<Y> type)
      Creates an empty, thread-safe array of the given type and zero initial capacity.
      Type Parameters:
      Y - the element type
      Parameters:
      type - the runtime class of the array elements
      Returns:
      a new empty ThreadSafeArray

    • finish

      public X[] finish()
      Finalizes the array size, preventing further additions and returning a read / update only snapshot of the contents.

      This method blocks until all concurrent writes in progress have completed.

      After calling this method, any further calls to put(Object) will throw a ThreadSafeArray.ReadOnlyException.

      Returns:
      a fixed-size copy of the array containing all elements

    • get

      public X get(int p)
      Retrieves the element at the specified index. Waiting if necessary until it is available.

      If called before finish(), this method throws an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException if the element does not yet exist.

      Callers should ensure that the index is within bounds as reported by current write progress (e.g., via size()).

      Parameters:
      p - index of the element to retrieve
      Returns:
      the element at the given index

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks whether no elements have been written yet.
      Returns:
      true if size() == 0

    • parallelStream

      public Stream<X> parallelStream()
      Returns a parallel stream of the elements currently visible for reading.

      Like stream(), this reflects the ideal state of the array at the time of the call. It may have to wait for items to become fully available.

      Returns:
      a parallel stream of the array contents

    • put

      public int put(X value)
      Adds an element to the array.

      This method is safe to call from multiple threads concurrently. If the internal array needs resizing, only one thread will perform the resize operation while others wait.

      Parameters:
      value - the element to add
      Returns:
      the index at which the element was inserted
      Throws:
      ThreadSafeArray.ReadOnlyException - if called after finish()

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the number of elements successfully written so far.

      This value may be less than the actual array capacity due to dynamic resizing.

      Returns:
      the current count of written elements

    • stream

      public Stream<X> stream()
      Returns a sequential stream of the elements currently visible for reading.

      The stream reflects the ideal state of the array at the time of the call. It may have to wait for all items to become available.

      Returns:
      a sequential stream of the array contents

    • update

      public void update(int index, X value)
      Updates the value at the specified index, assuming the value already exists, and the initial loading phase is complete but the array has not been finalised.

      This method is thread-safe and supports concurrent writes to different indices.

      Parameters:
      index - the index at which to update the element
      value - the element to update
      Throws:
      ThreadSafeArray.ReadOnlyException - if called after the array has been finalized
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of bounds
